title: (x) small cap serif face 'i' with dot - Incognito {Stephen}
content:
Hello, could you please help me remembering what is the text font I’ve seen with a small cap ’i’ with dot by default ?  
I kind of remember a design by Schwartz but maybe it was Bil’ak.  
If you know other SC font having this “glyphing,” please let me know, much appreciate.

 [‹ Looking for a gothic sans w/ slightly rounded corners - can you help?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121004307/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32249 "Go to previous forum topic") [Dick Tracy comic book logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121004307/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32288 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Alessandro Segalini

comments.content: It’s just about the only thing I don’t like about [Incognito](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121004307/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FT.123355.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Incognito&sampleSize=48).
No it was not Incognito, but thanks Stephen.

[ARS Deviata](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121004307/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ARS.127242.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=seGalinI&sampleSize=48) is unicase and is probably so new you haven’t seen it, but have a look.

Thanks for this new reference, Stephen ; the thing is that Turkish language wants the dot on the ı sometimes, and I am wondering about this issue for SC book titling.  
Which will be the right slot in the font then, if not found by default ?

I’m sorry, I’m not sure what you’re asking. Are you creating a font and wanting to know about character encodings or looking for a typeface with small caps and [Turkish](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121004307/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=turkish) support?

Cool, Stephen. Yes, I am doing a title font, only caps/smallcaps and I’d like to know if it is a strange habit to have the small cap _i with dot_ as default for a multilanguage supporting SC font. Thanks fro replying in the ID section——I was looking for comparison and I seem not to find this specimen printout I remember I had, I know I thought, “uau, this is a clever trick, a good writing actualization, yet a good visually balanced text face.”
